thorwin.math

Class Math

  • java.lang.Object
    • thorwin.math.Math

  • public final class Math
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains very general math functions. Usually these functions are statically imported.

    • Method Detail

      • gcd

        public static int gcd(int a,
                      int b)
        Calculates greatest common divisor of two integers. If 0 is passed to one parameter, the other parameter is returned.
        Parameters:
        a - integer value a
        b - integer value b
        Returns:
        greatest common divisor
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if the GCD results in 231, which can not be represented in an integer. This can only happen if you pass Integer.MIN_VALUE to one of its values.

      • even

        public static boolean even(int a)
        Determines if the value is even
        Parameters:
        a - value to test
        Returns:
        true if the value is even

      • odd

        public static boolean odd(int a)
        Determines if the value is odd
        Parameters:
        a - value to test
        Returns:
        true if the value is odd

      • gcd

        public static long gcd(long a,
                       long b)
        Calculate greatest common divisor of two long integers. If 0 is passed to one parameter, the other parameter is returned.
        Parameters:
        a - integer value a
        b - integer value b
        Returns:
        greatest common divisor
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if the GCD results in 263, which can not be represented in an integer. This can only happen if you pass Long.MIN_VALUE to one of its values.

      • even

        public static boolean even(long a)
        Determines if the value is even
        Parameters:
        a - value to test
        Returns:
        true if the value is even

        Determines if the value is odd

        Returns:
        true if the value is odd

      • polyfit

        public static double[] polyfit(double[] xs,
                               double[] ys,
                               int order)
        Performs a polynomial fitting
        Parameters:
        xs - x-values
        ys - y-values
        order - order of the polynomial fit (should be less than number of points).
        Returns:
        polynomial coefficients

                                double... coefficients)
        Calculates the polynomial for the specified x value.
        Parameters:

        coefficients - polynomial coefficients
        Returns:
        result of the polynomial calculation

        Returns:
        standard deviation

      • standardDeviation

        public static double standardDeviation(boolean population,
                                       double... values)
        Calculates the standard deviation.
        Parameters:
        values - samples
        population - flag that indicates the data is a complete population (false indicates a sample).
        Returns:
        standard deviation

      • variance

        public static double variance(boolean population,
                              double... values)
        Calculates the variance using a compensated-summation algorithm.
        Parameters:
        population - indicates the values are the complete population, instead of samples
        values - the values
        Returns:
        the variance

      • mean

        public static double mean(double... values)
        Calculates the average for the specified values.
        Parameters:
        values - input values
        Returns:
        average of the values

      • variance

        public static double variance(double... values)
        Calculates the variance of samples.
        Parameters:
        values - samples
        Returns:
        the variance

      • prime

        public static int prime(int index)
        Get a prime number. This method allows access to the first 10.000 prime numbers (all primes from 2 up to 104729).
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the prime number in the range [0-9999]
        Returns:
        The prime number.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - for index greater than 9999

      • isPrime

        public static boolean isPrime(int value)
        Determines if a value is a prime number. This method is limited to the first 10.000 prime numbers (prime 2...104729).
        Parameters:
        value - the value to test
        Returns:
        true if the value is a prime number
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - for values exceeding 104729
